    <div class="section" id="about"><h1>What is Biodiversity loss?</h1><hr></div>

    <div class="container">
      <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-4">
          <div class="well">
            <img src="https://www.iberdrola.com/documents/20125/41125/PerdidaBiodiversidad_746x419.jpg/beae1e3d-93ac-392c-277e-13f10ea30c6b?t=1628158320684" style="height:100%; width:100%">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-md-8">
          <div class="well">
            <h3>BIODIVERSITY LOSS</h3>
            <p>The planet's biodiversity is under threat and the main culprit is the one who, paradoxically, depend on it most: human being. Slowing down biodiversity loss, understood as the reduction or disappearance of the variety of living beings that inhabit the planet, is one of humanity's great challenges. Below, we review the causes, consequences and possible solutions.</p>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div><!--/.row-->
    </div><!--/.container-->

    <div class="section" id="what-i-do"><h1>More</h1><hr></div>

    <div class="container">
      <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-8">
          <div class="well">
            <h3>CAUSES</h3>
            <div class="spacer"></div>
            <h3>Biodiversity has declined at an alarming rate in recent years, largely as a result of human activity. Let's take a look at some of the main causes: </h3>
 <br>
          <h4 id="kitty">
Climate change: Climate change impacts biodiversity at various levels: species distribution, population dynamics, community structure and the functioning of the ecosystem.  <br><br>
Pollution: When we talk about pollution, we may think of car exhaust fumes billowing into the atmosphere, but biodiversity is not only affected by this type, it is also affected by noise pollution and light pollution.  
              <br><br>
Destruction of habitats: Soil pollution and changes in its uses due to activities such as deforestation have a negative impact on ecosystems and the species that make them up. 
 <br><br>
Invasive alien species: Invasive alien species are the second biggest cause of loss of biodiversity in the world, according to the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP). They act as predators, compete for food, hybridise with native species, introduce parasites and diseases, etc. 
 <br><br>
Overexploitation of the natural environment: The overexploitation of natural resources, that is, their consumption at a speed greater than that of their natural regeneration, has an obvious impact on the planet's flora and fauna. </h4>
              </div><!--/.col-6-->
            </div>
          </div>
      </div><!--/.row-->
    </div><!--/.container-->

    <div class="container hidden-lg">
      <div class="row">
        <div class="col-md-12 col-sm-12 col-xs-12">
          <div class="well">
            <h3><i class="fa fa-code"> </i>&nbsp;EFFECTS ON PLANTS</h3>
            <h4>Biodiversity is critical for maintaining ecosystem health. Declining biodiversity lowers an ecosystem’s productivity (the amount of food energy that is converted into the biomass) and lowers the quality of the ecosystem’s services (which often include maintaining the soil, purifying water that runs through it, and supplying food and shade, etc.).</h4>
          </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-md-12 col-sm-12 col-xs-12">
          <div class="well">
            <h3><i class="fa fa-fighter-jet"></i>&nbsp;EFFECTS ON ANIMALS</h3>
            <h4>The loss of genes and individuals threatens the long-term survival of a species, as mates become scarce and risks from inbreeding rise when closely related survivors mate. The wholesale loss of populations also increases the risk that a particular species will become extinct.</h4>
          </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-md-12 col-sm-12 col-xs-12">
          <div class="well">
            <h3><i class="fa fa-arrows-alt"></i>&nbsp;EFFECTS ON HUMANS</h3>
            <h4>Biodiversity underpins the health of the planet and has a direct impact on all our lives. Put simply, reduced biodiversity means millions of people face a future where food supplies are more vulnerable to pests and disease, and where fresh water is in irregular or short supply. For humans that is worrying.</h4>
          </div>
        </div>
        <div class="col-md-12 col-sm-12 col-xs-12">
          <div class="well">
            <h3><i class="fa fa-bolt"></i>&nbsp; PRECAUTIONS</h3>
            <h4>Support local and regional projects aimed at tackling biodiversity loss. Buying fewer products and making sure the products you do buy minimise the impact on biodiversity. Investing in ways that promote biodiversity. Reducing waste of consumer goods: food, clothes, electrical appliances, etc.</h4>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div><!--/.row-->
    </div><!--/.container and mobile work-->
